templateAssets.content:
The African and Middle Eastern Studies major provides an interdisciplinary approach to studying the history, culture, politics, geography, economics, language, and philosophy of the region - from Morocco through Iran.


Listed below are the lower division preparation courses for the major.


To be considered for this major, you must complete the following by the end of spring before transfer:

  • One year of college level language in Arabic, Armenian, Hebrew, Persian, Turkish or
  • An African language or at least one year of high school in which the primary language of instruction was Arabic, Armenian, Hebrew, Persian, Turkish or
  • An African language AND at least two preparatory courses listed below (in addition to the foreign language).

Completion of intermediate/advanced foreign language is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED. A placement exam is required for all language majors regardless of credits earned in lower division language courses.

All courses must be taken for a letter grade by the end of spring term before transfer.


For more information regarding this major and UCLA's transfer selection process, visit https://international.ucla.edu/academics/ids and https://admission.ucla.edu.


PLEASE NOTE: the community college courses listed below have been approved to satisfy the preparation for this major at UCLA, but they may not be exact equivalents of the UCLA courses listed.

course.courseTitle: Introduction to International and Area Studies

templateAssets.content:
The AP/IB Exam Scores listed below may be used to satisfy major prep:

  • A score of 3 or higher on the AP Comparative Government exam can be used in place of the comparative politics course (POL SCI 50).
  • A score of 5 or higher on the IB HL Economics exam can be used in place of the microeconomics course (ECON 1).
